Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2007 02:20PM clubmember5 wrote: I took taxotere and cytoxin, 4 treatments, one every three weeks. I was lucky and had very little side effects during treatments.  I have however had joint, bone, and muscle pain since.  Nothing I can't live with, just annoying.  My white blood count hasn't come back up like I would have hoped to, but Dr. doesn't seem concerned at this point.  I finished chemo in March 07.  Good luck and stay well. clubmember 5
Posts.Title: any advice on taxolene side effects ? omyoga clubmember5

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2008 02:15PM - edited Jan 8, 2008 03:26PM by clubmember5 Dear Jennifer,  I know you are scared.  I was diagnoised Oct.06 with stage 2A.  One micromet in node and 3 small grade 1 tumors. ER+,PR+ Her2-did not show up in a mammogram, it was in an old biopsy site.  In her support message Actress Lynn Redgrave says she refuses to die from breast cancer.  I have heard broccolli sprouts , vitamin D and moderate exercise help keep us healthy. And lots of frest fruits and vegetables help keep it away.  I say let's try it!!  LET'S ALL SAY WE ARE GOING TO LOOK IT IN THE EYE AND SAY  Go AWAY AND STAY GONE  I have several friends who have been where we are and they tell me when I have a scary moment "You're going to be fine".  I think if we say that over and over we will be. We will support each other. My surgeon says I'll be fine and so does my onc. I had a bilateral mastectomy and did well, 4 rounds of taxotere and cytoxin with no problems.  I hope this was a good sign that all will be ok! Take care, Mary Jane clubmember5
Posts.Title: 29 and SCARED What does 5 yr survival rate mean? genavive clubmember5
